required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Bimatoprost Solution in Treating Eyelash Loss or Hypotrichosis in Children

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of bimatoprost solution 0.03% once daily application to the upper eyelid margins compared with vehicle in treating eyelash loss or hypotrichosis (inadequate or not enough eyelashes) in children.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event was any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, or disease associated with the use of the study drug, whether or not considered related to the study drug.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least a 1-Grade Improvement From Baseline in the Global Eyebrow Assessment (GEA) Score
primary_outcome.description: The physician evaluated the overall eyelash prominence in both eyes using the GEA 4-point scale: 1= minimal, 2= moderate, 3= marked and 4= very marked. A 1-grade improvement in the GEA score from Baseline indicated improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Upper Eyelash Length as Measured by Digital Image Analysis (DIA)
secondary_outcome.description: Photographs were taken of the eyelashes and assessed using DIA. Length was measured in millimeters (mm). Data from both eyes were averaged for each participant for analysis. A positive change from Baseline indicated longer length (improvement).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Upper Eyelash Thickness as Measured by DIA
secondary_outcome.description: Photographs were taken of the eyelashes and assessed using DIA. Eyelash thickness (fullness) was assessed across both eyes as an average and is measured in millimeters squared (mm^2). A positive change from Baseline indicated fuller eyelashes (improvement).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Upper Eyelash Darkness as Measured by DIA
secondary_outcome.description: Photographs were taken of the eyelashes and assessed using DIA. Eyelash darkness (intensity) was measured in both eyes and averaged for analysis using a scale where 0=black and 255=white. A negative change from Baseline indicated darker eyelashes (improvement).

arm_group.description: One drop applied to a sterile single-use-per-eye applicator and applied to upper eyelid margin (where the eyelashes meet the skin) once nightly for 4 months.
One drop applied to a sterile single-use-per-eye applicator and applied to upper eyelid margin (where the eyelashes meet the skin) once nightly for 4 months.

intervention.description: One drop applied to a sterile single-use-per-eye applicator and applied to upper eyelid margin (where the eyelashes meet the skin) once nightly for 4 months.
One drop applied to a sterile single-use-per-eye applicator and applied to upper eyelid margin (where the eyelashes meet the skin) once nightly for 4 months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children who have inadequate eyelashes or have lost their eyelashes as a result of chemotherapy treatment, who completed their chemotherapy (intensive treatment) at least 4 weeks before starting the study, are considered to be at low risk for relapse of their cancer, and are well enough to complete the study
- Children who have minimal to moderate inadequate eyelashes due to alopecia areata
- Adolescents between the ages of 15-17 years who have minimal to marked inadequate eyelashes
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any eye disease or abnormality, eye surgery, permanent eyeliner, eyelash implants.
- Semi-permanent eyelash tint, dye or eyelash extension application within 3 months
- Use of over the counter eyelash growth products within 6 months.
- Use of prescription eyelash growth products (eg, Latisse®)
- Any eye condition that would prevent required ophthalmology exams

group.title: Bimatoprost Ophthalmic Solution 0.03%
group.description: One drop applied to a sterile single-use-per-eye applicator and applied to upper eyelid margin (where the eyelashes meet the skin) once nightly for 4 months.

group.title: Vehicle Sterile Solution
group.description: One drop applied to a sterile single-use-per-eye applicator and applied to upper eyelid margin (where the eyelashes meet the skin) once nightly for 4 months.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events
outcome.description: An adverse event was any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, or disease associated with the use of the study drug, whether or not considered related to the study drug.
outcome.population: Safety population included all randomized participants who received treatment.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events
measure.description: An adverse event was any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, or disease associated with the use of the study drug, whether or not considered related to the study drug.
measure.population: Safety population included all randomized participants who received treatment.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline Upper Eyelash Length as Measured by Digital Image Analysis (DIA)
outcome.description: Photographs were taken of the eyelashes and assessed using DIA. Length was measured in millimeters (mm). Data from both eyes were averaged for each participant for analysis. A positive change from Baseline indicated longer length (improvement).
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat population included all randomized participants.

group.title: Bimatoprost Ophthalmic Solution 0.03%
group.description: One drop applied to a sterile single-use-per-eye applicator and applied to upper eyelid margin (where the eyelashes meet the skin) once nightly for 4 months.

group.title: Vehicle Sterile Solution

measure.title: Change From Baseline Upper Eyelash Length as Measured by Digital Image Analysis (DIA)
measure.description: Photographs were taken of the eyelashes and assessed using DIA. Length was measured in millimeters (mm). Data from both eyes were averaged for each participant for analysis. A positive change from Baseline indicated longer length (improvement).
measure.population: Intent-to-treat population included all randomized participants.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Upper Eyelash Thickness as Measured by DIA
outcome.description: Photographs were taken of the eyelashes and assessed using DIA. Eyelash thickness (fullness) was assessed across both eyes as an average and is measured in millimeters squared (mm^2). A positive change from Baseline indicated fuller eyelashes (improvement).
outcome.population: Participants from the Intent-to-treat population, that included all randomized participants, with data available at Baseline and Month 4.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
